page.title: 07An interview
page.content: We went to a house in Croyde Bay to interview Mr & Mrs Manning who are about 80 and have lived here all their life. They didn't have many holidays, infact their first holiday was in 1938,and if you didn't go to work on Bank Holiday you dont get paid! They didn't get mains water in the area until 1950! so they had to walk to a pump to get water. For food they would get some vegetables from their garden and get some rabbit.Meat then cost 10 pence a lb when nowadays it might cost 1pound 50p per lb. For V.E Day celebrations the people of Croyde had a bonfire and the children had a fancy dress party. During the war the Americans were using Baggy Point as a firing range.
